p: Different kinds of terpenes show different effects on the parasites. For instance, beta-myrcene the most common terpenes, is proven to have in vitro antiplasmodial activity (Kpoviessi et al. 2014). Beta-myrcene from , the plant which is high in terpenes, does not show an anti plasmodial effect but extracts from stem, leaves, and seeds of clove basil showed a good antiplasmodial activity (Small 2017; Kpoviessi et al. 2014). Additionally, it was also reported to have antitrypanosomal activity when tested against (Habila et al. 2010). This data leads to the fact that terpenes are effective against pathogenic Protista.
